reviews.text: Remarkable house you see when cycling in Groningen along the Hoornsemeer. It is actually part of the Groningen Museum and was designed by John Quentin Hejduk. Was also visited by the famous Maarten van Rossem family on Dutch TV.
A modern art building that is used as a gallery.
Grande referência do início da arquitetura pós moderna. A casa funciona como museu aos sábados e domingos.

Wall house #2 is in 1967 ontworpen door John Hejduk, en na zijn overlijden in 2000 is het huis daadwerkelijk gebouwd.

Ik heb het huis bezocht tijdens het wall house weekend, en kan het van harte aanbevelen. Leuk om een halfuurtje mee te vullen! Het was wel leuk geweest als de woning iets verder was ingericht
Keurig
Great museum full of artifacts but none of the signs are in English!
totally awesome place if u like ships
Lovely building and walk through Dutch naval history. Needs more than 1 visit and more information in English.
cute littlet museum. no English signs.
Nice collection of model ships and diesel and steam engines. Worth a visit.

A very interesting and fun place to spend a couple of hours,shows a really cool part of Dutch cultural and history. It's fantastic that some of the exhibits are interactive. There's a guide sheet you can get in English but the exhibits are written in only Dutch. This doesn't matter too much as visually it's really accessible. All and all a cool place,and Frank one of the guys working there is A-1 👌

It is a nice museum. Yet I went there expecting to learn sth on comics. For example what are the different styles and how to recognize them. In general the museum is more suited for people who are already in comics and want to see valuable collectors items and want to know more on their idol comic writers.

Large amount of original art, though not many internationally known works. So this is more for people interested in the making and history of comics if you do not speak dutch. Unfortunatelly only comics in dutch laguage in the museum shop.
I love comic trips and it's a great place to take the kids.

An excellent place to go! A good overview of contemporary and historic comics in The Netherlands. Lots of fun and entertaining!!! 
(A lot of images speak for themselves, also good with a Dutch speaking companion)

Very limited range of information, and most of the exhibition is simply displaying old equipment. Fairly reasonable entry price, but not really that interesting a place. With more information and some more innovative exhibits, this could be rather interesting. Right now it's simply old (if lovely) printing machines.

The employees are really nice and dedicated and show you around and give you very detailed impressions on the work. Unfortunately, for the admission, the things and pictures shown are not really worth the price. Sometimes, we also missed explainations for the art to get the whole picture.

It's not for everyone, but if you have a reasonable interest in printing and lettering and stuff, it's quite nice.
The museum is quite bland but the staff really makes up for it. They are obviously very involved and excited to tell you everything they know. Over 3 employees/volunteers told them seemingly all they know about the machines, book binding techniques ect.
Would reccomend if you don't mind listening to that sort of things for up to a couple hours
Just incredible place for the art lovers:) many options to try what you like. My child also enjoyed it

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! I am a graphic designer and I started out on my career when computers first became available for public consumption in 1988. We used to use some of these machines and I love them. They are the computers of old. The people are very welcoming and knowledgeable and I enjoyed to home-made booklet exercise and watching the big old green giloutine in action. Perhaps the negative comments come from people who lack the imagination to see the part these these wonderful printing machines have played in our history and the people who had the expertise to use them... Perhaps something can be done to bridge the gap. A film perhaps? I'm available - ha ha.
We enjoyed an organ concerts at this place including a reception. It is an excellent place to organize events.

It is a nice place to host an event that does not require a big visual open space. It is excellent creating sections of presentation e.g. line of products, collection of paintings or sculptures. Accoustics are not great for groups of different talks/presentations. But it could be a good place for a concert or a single presentation setup.
It was a beautiful church, but it's a bit strange to see it like an event hall.
Nice with vine festival in a church
lots of great events are hosted in this great looking church.

Just nipped in for a coffee, but to be frank, the place feels somewhat chaotic and the coffee was OK, so was the apple pie, although I can't call it a proper apple pie per se. The building looks nicer on the outside than it is sitting on the inside. OK place, very charming building to see, but all in all just an OK place.
A nice place to have dinner. Not too fancy. But with a lot of character. Nice simple menu. The people know what they are serving and give good advice. Good for a repeat visit.
Amazing place to relax,drink and eat and the staff is friendly,
Nice place to have a beer and lunch

Amazing lunch and dinner in a beautiful historic building.Nice atmosphere location for lunch or a cup of coffee, unfortunately no dinner is served here if I had understood this correctly.Spent delicious outside on the terrace last weekend. Best citizens in town! And the satay is also highly recommended!

Definitely worth a visit. Visit the tourist information center nearby to purchase an entry token. The stairs are narrow but it wasn't too bad. Once you reach the first outer area you can continue further up using a second set of stairs.

Stellar view from the top! If you can withstand the claustrophobic emotions while climbing the stairs it definitely worth the effort! Must see for a tourist or a student! I think it is also free for student card holders so extra motivation!!
One of the most beautiful building in groningen. You can go to the top and see the beautiful city of Groningen

Stunning views of all of Groningen.

You can climb up to the large bells, and get shocked as they go off earlier than you expected.

The ticket was super cheap, and on the Friday after noon in December, it was alone for most of my time up there
Worth visiting for what we pay. Be prepared for a congested passage. 120+ steps. Historical.

A very nice museum based in a very historic building, though it is actually easy to miss if you are just wandering around Delft. It possesses a number of important objects from Dutch history, though to its credit the museum often notes that some of said objects may not be genuine. Worth a visit.
Definitely the highlight of my weekend in Delft. I really  recommend it for history geeks like me. I really appreciated to learn so much about the genealogy of the royal family.
Very interesting and beautiful museum to visit. Learned a lot

The Prinsenhof primarily tells the story of a political assassination - not the last one in the Netherlands. The founder of the country William “the silent” of Orange lived here and was killed by Balthasar Gerardts, who sided with the Spanish. The bullet holes are famously still visible in the wall! The museum has lots of gorgeous 16th and 17th century paintings, a nice collection of historical Delft Blue pottery, and is connected to the Wallon church. Museum shop and restaurant also available.
Beautiful place with so much things worth to see!

Remnants of the main synagogue of Barcelona. Do not expect an actual synagogue, the Jewish community was forcefully converted in 1391, and it's main sites thoroughly destroyed. 
What remains of Jewish memory in Barcelona is scattered, and easy to overlook.
The hidden gem here are the guided visits the synagogue provides in Spanish, English, Hebrew, etc. They will help you to understand jewish life in medieval Barcelona.
They charge to go in so we didn't get past the front room. Looks cool though.
Worth a visit, €3.50 donation to enter. Quite small but full of fantastic history and staff give short speech on the jewish history and how it links in with Barcelona.

I had the pleasure to photograph a beautiful intimate wedding in the old Synagogue. I loved the atmosphere, the staff was very friendly, all prepared till a small little details for a perfect celebration.

We was not able to find the place on our first visit to Barcelona. It was around midnight in the middle of October - very common time for Barcelona to be out and explore place around. We wanted to find the Ancient Synagogue to be able to come here again at the day time. Interesting to say, at we were not alone, there was another couple trying to find the place - no luck. We returned next year at the day time,  we did it! It was worth the time and money to know the background of the Call carrer (Jewish community location in Barcelona).
Love this park! Great place to chill and enjoy your surroundings! And sometimes great festivals!

Het Noorderplantsoen. Het mooiste park in de mooiste stad van Nederland. Het heeft heuvel(tje)s en die zijn zeldzaam in Groningen, het heeft water prachtig door het hele park heen lopen met verschillende soorten bomen, 2 grote grasvelden. Één met een mooie muziekkoepel en de ander met een groot kinder klemrek. Worden leuke evenementen gehouden hier zoals Noorderzon en de plantsoen loop. Een heerlijk parkje dus. Ook in de herfst!
Ook een hele fijne plaats voor ontspanning
Beste plek om te chillen in Groningen met mooi weer!
Variety of cheeses and really friendly personnel
Superb!!!

Dit is een klote zaak. De kaas is heel erg duur. Je kunt kaas béter in de supermarkt kopen. Het personeel is ook niet heel vriendelijk. Bovendien is de naam van de oude eigenaar. Ze hadden dit al lang moeten wijzigen!
De Rolls Royce onder de kaaswinkels. Wat n prachtige zaak! Ik kan er niet voorbij lopen...😍
Heute da gewesen. Sehr guter Laden. Riesen auswahl!

We came with a party of 11 people. Great food very delicious, although it took forever to get the right drinks. Staff is very inexperienced and forgot to ask if I wanted to have second drink. Furthermore, they also forgot to give me the orange juice that should have come with my menu. Lastly, a drafty door had to be opened since otherwise they could not hear the kitchen staff. This resulted in a very cold and unpleasant experience for some guest of my party.
Really nice atmosphere and friendly staff. The food was good and I think it was not too expensive. The venue was bright, airy and clean.
Good restaurant, we had a small but nice lunch here.
Excellent food😁
I visit the bar just for a glass of wine. Nice cozy & place

We had the 3 course taster menu, the starter (bean soup with truffle) was great. The desserts were ok to good. The dishes in the main were not that interesting. When choosing a taster menu I expect more that for example conventional salmon and potatoes, there was also very salty risotto which we couldnt finish. Service was ok but a bit messy (forgetting cutlery for example).
I think the experience would have been better if we chose a normal dish instead of the taster menu.

An Italian restaurant that doesn't serve bread as an appetizer for free. Unacceptable

The Berata Caprice was provided with a minasucle piece of bread. Laughable!
Italian sounding but definitely not Italian. Literally nothing of the menu is related with traditional cooking from Tuscany. However food is ok and staff is gentle.
For the price it's not a good choice. It is not traditional Italian cusine and took a lot of time to be served. The location though is good
Great italian food
Fresh food. Friendly service. Good coffee.  The atmosphere really depends on where you sit. For lunch I was a bit overpriced.

Nice place, good food. 
Meat was amazing but the side dish was plain and boring  greens and carrots. 
The attention was extremely good tho.
Nice restaurant, good food and nice atmosphere.
Nice place. We went here for lunch with a big group. Took a while to get our food, but staff was kind and professional and we talked during waiting anyway.

Waiting staff? What waiting staff? We gpt your drink orders? wrong. You are going to have what we serve you sir, not what you ordered. And you neither madam. We´re sure you´ll like it and most certainly not lower our ridiculously high price for your drink because of our mistake, no be glad we don't charge you for the wrong one we brought you. 
 
And then they wonder why we leave after one drink, after 'lingering'. The lingering has to do with the fact we couldn't get anyone to come and bring us the bill. 

Over-priced incompetence. They've got it nailed.

It was our second visit at Humphrey's and it was AGAIN a very nice dinner!
Fresh and delicious food, very good service, nice cocktails and an absolute gorgeous restaurant. While you enjoy your dinner you can watch a silent movie or have a nice chat. The restaurant has a glamorous "the golden time of Hollywood" ambience.
I promise, this wouldn't be the last time we had a dinner there.
Good food, good service and nice atmosphere...
Good quality food for a decent price. Atmosphere is great. Only when it's full, it can be little bit loud.

Been here a couple of times on a group arrangement. A relatively small menu selection but there is something for everyone and it definitely keeps the things moving which is actually really nice. The interior decoration is pretty dark and although not really my style it is at least a consistent theme. Prices are fair and the food is good.
Nice location, great service and tasty dinner

Excellent costumer service with very nice staff. Atmosphere is very energetic and at the same time it is a cozy place. Food is really good and you can choose from how much hungry you are. Beer selection is concise and with excellent choices. Price is good as you can see in menu photos.
Very nice bar. Large range of drinks and cocktail bar is a fun place to drink. Although, it is very pricey.

Lovely ambience inside and out, and courteous staff. Lunch, however, is a let down. Canned tuna belongs in the home, not on focaccia at a restaurant! Mixed with balsamic vinegar and beef, which to my mind is a strange combination, and it didn't exactly work. Asian influences are fine, but should be kept in check. Bread itself was lovely. Good drinks selection. Needs tightening up, especially regarding price quality and selection.
Great atmosphere, the building alone is already worth five stars if you ask me. Staff was great and really knew their products

There are no words in my dictionary to describe this place to the fullest and hence I'm going to explain every bit of my experience along with pictures. We started with a tour of the place, which I would have never expected to see based on what the place looked like from the outside. There were such minute details that you've either heard of or seen in pictures that actually exist here. Right from the world war period newspaper on the wall to the ancient wine racks and Barrels and a fusion of these antiques with technology like the rotating wine glass rack to the arm that automatically serves 2 glasses of wine. The place even crafts it's own Gin, whisky, and other types of alcohol and soon Beer. Loved the mini distillery that dropped down from the roof to a particular table which I definitely want to try the next time I'm there. Not going to say more and ruin it for you who are reading, you need to visit to believe. The steak was amazing and everything else we ate. Would like to appreciate Nick who gave us an awesome tour, and he is definitely the man for the job. Highly recommended this place and I will visit again.
Very nice food. Their menu of the day has a vegetarian and a non-vegetarian option.
nice place. It offers good food for a reasonable price. Great location specially in the summer. Unfortunately it is frequently too crowded
Informeel gezellig. Voor een mooie prijs eten
Lekker, ongecompliceerd eten. Vega of vlees. Pilsje er bij. Helemaal prima
Altijd heerlijk. .!!! 😉

Awesome place! Got a warm welcome by the very chef (extremely kind person). They managed to accommodate me even though I had no reservation. Delightful food, very elegantly served. Beautiful deco and design offering a melange of classic and modern furniture style! Kind and discreet staff! Big YES!!
Delicious cozy
Overprised food, slow service.
One one the best fish restaurant in Groningen. Kind waiters and cozy place. A must in Groningen.
Very romantic setting and a great but quite expensive place for a date

They doing baby ear piercing here. The staff that work at the jewellery store are really friendly. They ways gave two staff to pierce baby ears as they do both at the same time to prevent added stress to the child which is perfect

Ignite Records is the best record store in the city. A real vinyl cavern that is packed with fairly priced records to suit a wide range of tastes. Rich (the owner) is a real gent, very knowledgeable and accommodating. The store is friendly and welcoming. Important we keep this indie going!
Legendary Birmingham fixture! Great place to get alternative/rock clothing and accessories  in an iconic location in the centre of town for nearly 50 years.

I have been going to Oasis for over 10 years now and every time you go in it is exciting, literally like a kid in a sweet shop. There is always something new and exciting going on. Highly recommend it!

Oasis has lost it appeal and is no longer a fashion markets. It's now full of rude and over priced tattoo parlours and pretentious "clothing shops". Not to mention the shops selling drug paraphernalia. 

Both inside and out the markets are rundown and are stuck in the 1980s and is in need of updating and bring in to this millennium. 
The markets also attracts the wrong kind of people and is a center of anti-social behaviour. I have often seen the police and security patrolling and moving people on. 

The Oasis markets are full of empty stalls and shops, which adds to the rundown feeling.

In conclusion, I would not recommend visting the markets for this reason.
